bevacizumab became standard of care as first - line treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer ( mcrc ) in association with chemotherapy , but not all patients benefit from bevacizumab treatment . 
 cumulative data , gathered from retrospective studies , show that bevacizumab - induced hypertension ( htn ) appears to be associated with a statistically significant improvement in response rates , progression - free survival ( pfs ) and overall survival ( os ) . 
 bevacizumab - related htn may serve as a predictor biomarker of response / survival in patients with mcrc treated with bevacizumb in first - line setting . 
 in our subset of patients , htn g2 - 3 demonstrated to be predictive of response to treatment with bevacizumab and of pfs . a trend towards a favourable os was observed . 
 thes
facts_entailed: Bevacizumab became the standard of care for first-line treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) in conjunction with chemotherapy, but not all patients benefited from bevacizumab treatment.

Cumulative data from retrospective studies indicate that bevacizumab-induced hypertension (HTN) is associated with a statistically significant improvement in response rates, progression-free survival (PFS), and overall survival (OS).
Bevacizumab-related HTN may serve as a predictor biomarker of response/survival in patients with mCRC treated with bevacizumab in the first-line setting.
In a subset of patients, grade 2-3 HTN was predictive of treatment response with bevacizumab and PFS.
A trend towards a favorable OS was observed in this subset of patients.

facts_entailed: The ability to monitor health status, disease onset, progression, recurrence, and treatment outcome through non-invasive means is highly important to advancing healthcare management.
Saliva (oral fluid) is a perfect medium to be explored, offering the potential for a non-invasive, easy-to-obtain means for detecting and monitoring disease.
Specimen collection is less objectionable to patients than in the case of other bodily fluids.

facts_entailed: Cardiovascular disorders include ischemic heart diseases.
Some people, particularly workers in certain industries, are at higher risk for cardiovascular disorders.
Many studies have been conducted on workers' health.
Studies focused on cardiovascular system due to its multifactorial nature and modifiable risk factors.
Risk factors for cardiovascular disorders assessed and measured include triglyceride, total cholesterol, LDL, HDL, blood pressure, obesity, smoking, genetics.
Shift work and stress are identified as risk factors.
Carboxyhemoglobin (COHB) and solvents are also considered risk factors.

vesicoureteral reflux ( vur ) occurs commonly in children , resulting in potentially serious complications . 
 this could result in renal scarring , hypertension , and even end - stage renal failure . 
 treatment options for children with vur include continuous antibiotic prophylaxis , endoscopic injections , and laparoscopic or open ureteroneocystostomy . since hutch   introduced open ureteral reimplantation to correct vur in 1952 , many such techniques have been developed . in 1984 , 
 endoscopic injections of tissueaugmenting material for the correction of vur were introduced ; since then , many urologists prefer this procedure . 
 endoscopic injection is frequently used now as a firstline treatment because it involves less pain and a shorter hospitalization period and leaves no scar ,
facts_entailed: The vesicoureteral reflux (VUR) occurs commonly in children.
Potentially serious complications can result from vesicoureteral reflux.
Renal scarring, hypertension, and end-stage renal failure are potential complications.
Treatment options for children with VUR include continuous antibiotic prophylaxis.
Endoscopic injections of tissue-augmenting material were introduced in 1984.
Since 1984, many urologists prefer endoscopic injections for the correction of VUR.
Endoscopic injection is frequently used as a first-line treatment.
Endoscopic injection involves less pain and a shorter hospitalization period.
Endoscopic injection leaves no scar.

facts_entailed: They have a continuing need for care and frequently move between primary care, hospital care, and municipal care for elderly persons.
Their situation demands some form of integration between health and social services.

Intracellular proteins are synthesized as pre-promature complexes in polysomes.
Prepromature parts are removed cotranslationally.
Mature parts are glycosylated by mannose-rich sugars.

Dysarthria is a presenting symptom of hypothyroidism and has only been reported once before.
A 39-year-old female presented to the clinic.

bicipital groove ( bg ) is an indentation on the anterior aspect of proximal part of humerus . 
 this groove allows tendon of long head of biceps brachi muscle enveloped in synovial sheath and ascending branch of anterior circumflex humeral artery to pass through it . 
 it is bounded medially by lesser tubercle , laterally by greater tubercle , and superiorly by bridging of transverse humeral ligament /muscle fibers of subscapularis , supraspinatus and pectoralis major muscles [ 2 , 3 ] . this groove with transverse humeral ligament / muscle fibers bridging it provides stability and smooth functioning of tendon of long head of biceps brachi muscle and prevents its subluxation during multidirectional biomechanical movements of arms . 
 apart from this , the greater function of biceps brachi
facts_entailed: The bicipital groove is an indentation on the anterior aspect of the proximal part of the humerus.
The groove allows the tendon of the long head of the biceps brachii muscle and the ascending branch of the anterior circumflex humeral artery to pass through it.

It is bounded medially by the lesser tubercle, laterally by the greater tubercle, and superiorly by the bridging of the transverse humeral ligament/muscle fibers of the subscapularis, supraspinatus, and pectoralis major muscles.

This groove with the transverse humeral ligament/muscle fibers bridging it provides stability and smooth functioning of the tendon of the long head of the biceps brachii muscle and prevents its subluxation during multidirectional biomechanical movements of the arms.

The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy of calretinin immunostaining in ganglionic and aganglionic hd colon biopsy specimens.
Our standard protocol of care for a child presenting with hd is a barium enema.

facts_entailed: Drug abuse is considered a critical health, social, and economic problem in most countries.
In the last three decades, the world has experienced shocking figures regarding drug abuse prevalence in societies, especially among teenagers and the youth.
The United Nations' Office on Drugs and Crime reported 185 million drug consumers worldwide and an increasing treatment demand globally.
Iranian drug abuse prevention headquarters estimated 4.5 million opium consumers in Iran by the end of 2004.

A study conducted by Serajzadeh and Feyzi in 21 Iranian state universities found that 5.8% of interviewed drug consumers claimed to be drug dependent, and 3.1% claimed high drug dependency, totaling 8.9%.

A study in southern France found that 5 to 8% of endocarditis cases were due to C. burnetii.

 the application of this technique creates the possibility of observing major brain metabolites that contributes to the major resonances seen in h mr spectra of the brain , such as n - acetylaspartate ( naa ) , creatine / phosphocreatine ( cr ) , choline - containing compounds ( cho ) , and myo - inositiols ( ins ) ( 1 - 3 )

This technique offers an insight into the metabolic processes of neurologic disorders.

conversion disorder has one or more symptoms that affect voluntary motor or sensory function suggesting a neurological or other medical condition , but they are inconsistent with known neurological or musculoskeletal pathologies . 
 instead , the symptoms are due to an unconscious expression of a psychological conflict or need . 
 the symptoms are often reinforced by social support from family and friends or by avoiding underlying emotional stress . 
 the symptoms of patients with conversion disorder can be debilitating and include paralysis of one or more limbs , ataxia , tremors , tics , and dystonia . 
 many other names are used to describe this disorder are functional gait disorder , hysterical paralysis , psychosomatic disorder , conversion reaction , and chronic neurosis .

facts_entailed: All participants provided informed consent prior to enrollment and all procedures conformed to the guidelines of the declaration of helsinki.

the use of dental implants to support and retain dental prostheses has been demonstrated to be clinically efficacious . 
 a precise fit between an implant abutment and a superstructure , determining the absence of bone tension , without the occlusal load , is an important factor for the long - term success of implant - supported restorations . 
 considering the fact that implants are completely surrounded by bone , and that the interface is not elastic , a minimum movement is observed due to bone deformation under loading . 
 accordingly , it must be anticipated that stress introduced into the implant system as the result of prosthesis misfit may be present many years after placement because of the ankylotic nature of the osseointegration . 
 the present findings support the concern for pr
facts_entailed: The use of dental implants is clinically efficacious.
A precise fit between an implant abutment and a superstructure, ensuring the absence of bone tension and lack of occlusal load, is crucial for the long-term success of implant-supported restorations.
Due to the ankylosis nature of osseointegration, a minimum movement is observed when implants are loaded.
Stress introduced into the implant system as a result of prosthesis misfit can persist for many years after placement.

diabetic neuropathy is a leading complication of diabetes mellitus , resulting in significant morbidity and mortality . 
 although its exact pathogenesis is not fully understood , hyperglycemia does not appear to be the sole factor in the development of neuropathy in diabetic patients . 
 enigmatically , recent reports have described that long - term tight glycemic control may be a major risk factor for the development of diabetic neuropathy [ 1 , 2 ] . 
 neuropathy secondary to rapid normalization of chronic hyperglycemia in the setting of poorly controlled diabetes is also emerging as a new disease entity classified as an iatrogenic complication . 
 symptoms in these patients are typically consistent with a distal sensory polyneuropathy which is appearing shortly after the initiation of
facts_entailed: The exact pathogenesis of diabetic neuropathy is not fully understood.
Recent reports suggest that long-term tight glycemic control may be a major risk factor for diabetic neuropathy.
A new disease entity, classified as an iatrogenic complication, is emerging where neuropathy develops due to rapid normalization of chronic hyperglycemia in poorly controlled diabetes.

facts_entailed: An estimate suggests that between 1.0 and 1.5 million individuals are infected with HIV in the United States.

By mid-1988, over 57,000 cases of AIDS had been reported to the Centers for Disease Control (CDC).

Thousands more are affected by AIDS-related complex (ARC).

54,000 persons with AIDS will die in 1991.
Nationally, 64 percent of AIDS cases will be reported by 1991.

facts_entailed: 36.9% of men and 38.0% of women worldwide are obese.
Obesity is usually accompanied by other diseases, the most common being type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2D), insulin resistance (IR), and cardiovascular complications.
Other metabolic consequences have been related, such as nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) or even many cancers.
Obesity is not the only problem in metabolic syndrome, but it is becoming more common due to rising obesity rates among adults.

 cases , in whom ipso is the primary clinical feature , are typically associated with connective tissue diseases . 
 however , ipso presenting as the first manifestation in systemic lupus erythematosus ( sle ) is rare , and < 30 cases of ipso in patients with sle have been reported ( 14 ) . 
 clinical features generally include severe abdominal symptoms , such as distension , pain , nausea and vomiting , while radiographic signs show gaseous small bowel distension with air - fluid levels .

facts_entailed: Cases of IPSO, where it is the primary clinical feature, are typically associated with connective tissue diseases.
IPOS presenting as the first manifestation in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is rare, with less than 30 cases reported.
Clinical features of IPSO include severe abdominal symptoms such as distension, pain, nausea, and vomiting.
Radiographic signs of IPSO show gaseous small bowel distension with air-fluid levels.
Acute lupus pneumonitis (ALP) is an uncommon pulmonary manifestation of SLE, and lung involvement has been reported in less than 3% of SLE patients.

facts_entailed: Military personnel face multiple stressors in their lives.
Studies have reported that stress occurs from risky assignments or missions.
The demand for physical fitness contributes to stress among military personnel.
Problems in interactions with peers and those of higher rank contribute to stress.
Sleep deprivation from shift work contributes to stress.
Deployment and separation from family contribute to stress.
Additional noncombat work assignments such as disaster relief, peacekeeping, and other humanitarian actions contribute to stress.
Home-front problems with spouses and children also impact military personnel.
Global defense budget cuts and the downsizing of military manpower increase the workload and stress of military personnel.
The World Health Organization's (WHO) definition of health includes physical, mental, and social aspects.

Spinal meningiomas are slow-growing tumors that typically cause symptoms only when they reach a considerable size to compress the spinal cord, causing local pain.

facts_entailed: desmoplastic fibroma (df) is a benign locally aggressive lesion of the bone.
It is recognized as an intra-osseous counterpart of soft tissue fibromatosis.
It is usually seen affecting the long bones, pelvis, and only occasionally presents as a jaw lesion.
The mandible is most commonly affected when compared to the maxilla and the cranium in the head and neck region.
A systematic literature search of the PubMed database using df and mandible as keywords revealed a total of 57 published cases occurring in the mandible alone from the year 1969 to 2014.
The exact cause for df is unknown.
Its pathogenesis is varied, ranging from genetic, endocrine, and traumatic factors to an exuberant reactive proliferation.
When differentiating it from other conditions, special attention should be paid to its unique characteristics.

 radiation therapy ( rt ) , alone or combined with chemotherapy , is a paramount approach as initial treatment option for npc . 
 distant metastasis , however , remains one of the major problems after radical treatment in patients with locally advanced disease .

facts_entailed: The highest incidence of npc is found among southern Chinese people, especially those of Cantonese origin.
Among Caucasians from North American and other Western countries, the incidence of npc is sporadic.
Radiation therapy (RT), alone or combined with chemotherapy, is a paramount approach as the initial treatment option for npc.
Distant metastasis remains one of the major problems after radical treatment in patients with locally advanced disease.

acute liver failure ( alf ) can be caused by the ingestion of mushrooms containing exceptionally powerful hepatotoxins . among mushroom intoxications , 
 the amatoxin syndrome is of primary importance because it accounts for about 90% of fatalities . 
 it is characterized by an asymptomatic incubation period followed by the gastrointestinal and hepatotoxic phases , leading eventually to multiorgan failure and death . 
 although the exact incidence of mushroom poisoning is not precisely estimated due to a presumably relatively high number of underreporting cases , amatoxin poisoning is a worldwide problem . 
 approximately 50100 fatal cases are reported every year in western europe , being less common in the united states ; however , cases of amatoxin poisoning from africa , asia , australi
facts_entailed: The term acute liver failure (ALF) can be caused by the ingestion of mushrooms containing exceptionally powerful hepatotoxins.
Among mushroom intoxications, the amatoxin syndrome is of primary importance, accounting for about 90% of fatalities.
The amatoxin syndrome is characterized by an asymptomatic incubation period followed by gastrointestinal and hepatotoxic phases, leading to multiorgan failure and death.
Although the exact incidence of mushroom poisoning is not precisely estimated due to underreporting, amatoxin poisoning is a worldwide problem.
Cases of amatoxin poisoning have been reported from Africa, Asia, and Australia.

exogenous endophthalmitis generally arises from a direct breech of external - ocular barrier as a complication of ocular trauma or intraocular surgery . 
 endogenous endophthalmitis is a rare form of endophthalmitis as it accounts for only 28% of all endophthalmitis cases [ 1 , 2 ] . 
 endogenous endophthalmitis is caused by breeching of the blood - ocular barrier by pathogens and is spread by blood - borne route originating from infective foci , for example , endocarditis , liver abscess , urinary tract infection ( uti ) , and meningitis . 
 although the infective foci can often be identified , isolated occurrence from iatrogenic source such as dental surgery and contaminated intravenous fluids are also possible [ 3 , 4 ] 
 . a number of systemic conditions might predispose patients in de
facts_entailed: Endogenous endophthalmitis accounts for only 28% of all endophthalmitis cases [1, 2].

Endogenous endophthalmitis is caused by a breach of the blood-ocular barrier by pathogens and is spread via the blood-borne route, originating from infective foci such as endocarditis, liver abscess, urinary tract infection (UTI), and meningitis.
Identifying the infective foci is common, but isolated occurrences can also originate from iatrogenic sources such as dental surgery and contaminated intravenous fluids [3, 4].
A number of systemic conditions may predispose patients to endophthalmitis.

facts_entailed: Permanent pacemaker implantation is one of the most important treatments for patients with clinically-significant atrioventricular block (AVB).

Coronary pathology was classified into 4 categories (Table 1).

 a recent indian study has shown that the burden of incident esrd in india continues to be substantial and is going to be a major health problem . moreover , due to the economic constraints , less than 10% of the patients receive definite renal replacement therapy . 
 malnutrition , which is multifactorial in origin , is one of the major hurdles ( 18 - 75% ) , contributing to mortality of dialysis patients . 
 restricted diet , metabolic
facts_entailed: The number of patients with chronic kidney diseases (CKD) in the USA aged 20 years and older exceeds 20 million according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
In India, the burden of incident end-stage renal disease (ESRD) is substantial and continues to be a major health problem.
Less than 10% of patients in India receive definite renal replacement therapy due to economic constraints.
Mortality among dialysis patients in India is significantly influenced by malnutrition, which affects up to 75% of cases.
Dietary restrictions contribute to the health issues faced by dialysis patients.

facts_entailed: There have been questions about its class I versus II versus III classification, or whether it is a lever at all.

The lever model, coupled with the bending beam analogy of the mandible, forms the foundation of the generally accepted (longitudinal) stress distribution pattern depicted in figure 1(a) and its variant, figure 1(b).
The lever is an oversimplified structural representation of the jaw.

facts_entailed: saccades are described as fast eye movements in which a target is tracked by registering the image of that target on the fovea.
The saccade neural network requires involvement of a series of neurons designed to imitate the behavior of actual neuronal populations in the horizontal saccade controller.

Continuing research effort in demonstrating such a model has been driven by the need to provide the means to develop a network of neurons, tailored to the complexity involved with inherent physiological evidence.

facts_entailed: Electronic cigarettes are battery-operated devices that deliver nicotine to the lungs through the evaporation of a liquid.
Chronic idiopathic neutrophilia is a condition characterized by elevated white blood cell and neutrophil counts without any underlying disease.
Smoking has been implicated as a potential cause of chronic idiopathic neutrophilia.
A male caucasian patient, born in 1977, presented in September 2005 with asymptomatic elevation of white blood cell and neutrophil count, and mildly elevated C-reactive protein levels.
The patient was a smoker since 1996 and was treated with 20 mg/day of simvastatin since 2003 due to hyperlipidemia.
Clinical examination and laboratory and imaging investigations ruled out any infectious, haematological, rheumatological, or endocrine conditions.

 recent studies regarding meta - analysis of the 5 rcts showed that stent - retriever thrombectomy is associated with considerable improvement of functional independence compared with standard medical care .

facts_entailed: Recent studies regarding meta-analysis of the 5 RCTs showed that stent-retriever thrombectomy is associated with considerable improvement of functional independence compared with standard medical care.

 he was nonalcoholic , and there was no history of diarrhea , hematochezia , or melena . 
 vital signs at admission were stable , and laboratory findings including white blood cell count , a liver function test and electrolytic balance were within the normal ranges . 
 electrocardiography revealed atrial fibrillation , and chest radiography demonstrated cardiomegaly ( not shown ) . to exclude acute appendicitis , initial ultrasonography ( us )

facts_entailed: A 65-year-old man was admitted to hospital with intermittent, colicky periumbilical pain that first occurred two months earlier.
He had an eight-year history of congestive heart failure caused by mitral valvular regurgitation and atrial fibrillation.
Vital signs at admission were stable.
Laboratory findings, including white blood cell count, a liver function test, and electrolytic balance, were within the normal ranges.
Electrocardiography revealed atrial fibrillation.
Chest radiography demonstrated cardiomegaly (not shown).
To exclude acute appendicitis, initial ultrasonography was performed.
Initial ultrasonography demonstrated diffuse, segmental, concentric wall thickening.

neuroblastoma is the most common extracranial solid tumor in childhood and accounts for 7% of malignancies in patients younger than 15 years . 
 it originates from the sympathetic nervous system , and in particular from a developing and incompletely committed precursor cell derived from neural - crest tissues . 
 neuroblastoma occurs sporadically in 98% of cases ; a genetic defect is involved in the rare familial neuroblastoma . in the subset of cases of neuroblastoma presenting in the context of other congenital abnormalities of the neural crest , the association with a germline loss - of - function mutation of homeobox gene phox2b has been demonstrated ; on the other hand , familial neuroblastoma not associated with other congenital disorders of the neural crest arises from activating mu
facts_entailed: In 98% of cases, neuroblastoma occurs sporadically; a genetic defect is involved in the rare familial neuroblastoma.

mature mirnas are short single - stranded rna molecules , approximately 1923 nucleotides in length . 
 the mirna sequence is encoded in a stem - loop structure in the primary transcript that is cleaved in the nucleus by the ribonuclease iii enzyme drosha to form the precursor mirna ( pre - mirna ) . 
 the pre - mirna is subsequently exported to the cytoplasm by the exportin and then is cleaved by another ribonuclease iii enzyme dicer to form mature mirna [ 13 ] . 
 mature mirnas can regulate the expression of a large number of genes at the posttranscriptional level . 
 mirna is partially complementary to the sequence of mirna recognition elements ( mre ) in the 3 untranslated regions ( utrs ) of target mrnas . 
 the seed sequence with seven nucleotides in mirna determines the specificity o
facts_entailed: Mature miRNAs can regulate the expression of a large number of genes at the posttranscriptional level.

altmetrics creates a new approach to evaluating the impact of publications by considering the number of downloads , shares , and discussions on social networks.1 this approach does not replace the traditional bibliometric indicators , such as impact factor and h - index , but rather focuses on new aspects of publication impact.2 although still in its infancy , altmetrics has the potential to become a valid assessment strategy for the evaluation of publication impact.3 altmetric tools capture information through the use of metrics from html views and downloads of articles , blog posts , tweets , bookmarks , etc . 
 all of these sources are alternative indicators of impact that go beyond traditional citation , focusing on the content and uses of the social web,4 with this information provide
facts_entailed: altmetrics creates a new approach to evaluating the impact of publications.
This approach does not replace traditional bibliometric indicators such as impact factor and h-index.
Altmetrics focuses on new aspects of publication impact.
Altmetrics has the potential to become a valid assessment strategy for the evaluation of publication impact.
Altmetric tools capture information through metrics from various sources including html views and downloads.
These sources provide alternative indicators of impact that go beyond traditional citation.
These sources focus on the content and uses of the social web.

facts_entailed: Clinical presentation is variable and may include skin manifestations like recurrent oral or genital ulcers, cns, articular, and ocular signs as described by the International Study Group of Behçet's Disease as the key diagnostic features.
Diverse vasculopathies and thrombophilia of any size and in any vessel are associated with Behçet's disease.
Behçet's disease can complicate with cardiac tamponade, hemorrhagic pericarditis, TTP, DVT, coronary artery stenosis, and a coronary artery pseudo-aneurysm.
A 37-year-old woman presented with syncope to the emergency room.

like most other cells and organisms , bacteria and archaea need to handle the threat of viral infection that kill the organism or reduce their fitness . 
 it matters little how successful an organisms is at other aspects of its life if it can not deal with its viruses . that fact contributes to the multitude of anti - virus defense mechanisms we see in nature . 
 the defenses can be divided into innate systems , which recognize certain pre - set features to limit infection , and adaptive systems , that are able to learn to recognize threats that were previously not recognized . 
 microorganisms contain a variety of innate defense mechanisms , such as preventing dna injection , cleaving certain sequences using restriction - modification systems , preventing phage proliferation by bacterioph
facts_entailed: The defenses can be divided into innate systems, which recognize certain preset features to limit infection, and adaptive systems, that are able to learn to recognize threats that were previously not recognized.

Microorganisms contain a variety of innate defense mechanisms, such as preventing DNA injection, cleaving certain sequences using restriction-modification systems, and preventing phage proliferation by bacteriophage systems.

Drug resistance mutations can emerge in almost all influenza A subtypes/strains, including the pandemic 2009 H1N1 virus.

facts_entailed: A 57-year-old woman was admitted to the hospital for further evaluation of a mass in the upper abdomen.
The mass was incidentally detected by an abdominal ultrasound exam during a medical checkup.
Her medical history included cholecystolithiasis and a fatty liver diagnosed two years prior.
On admission, laboratory tests showed an extremely high level of -fetoprotein (AFP) > 35,350 ng/ml (reference: < 20 ng/ml).
Carbohydrate antigen (CA) 19-9, CA125, blood amylase, aspartate transaminase (AST), alanine transaminase (ALT), and bilirubin levels were within the normal ranges.

rheumatoid arthritis ( ra ) is the most common rheumatoid condition and affects approximately 2% of adult population . 
 the onset of the disease usually takes place between the 45 and 55 year of age and , if not diagnosed early , it rapidly leads to permanent deformities of the motor organs . 
 the most frequently affected anatomic area in the course of ra is the hand ( anatomically , the hand is made up of the wrist , metacarpus and fingers ) . 
 the term rheumatoid hand denotes the hand deformed in the course of ra , which results from : the injury to the ligamentous complex of the midcarpal , carpometacarpal , metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints ; deformity of the bone bases that compose the joints as well as post - inflammatory lesions in the tendon sheaths and tendons ( fi
facts_entailed: rheumatoid arthritis (RA) is the most common rheumatoid condition and affects approximately 2% of the adult population.
The onset of the disease usually takes place between the ages of 45 and 55.
The most frequently affected anatomic area in the course of RA is the hand.
The hand is made up of the wrist, metacarpus, and fingers.
The term rheumatoid hand refers to the hand deformed in the course of RA.
The deformation of the hand in RA results from injuries to the ligamentous complex of the midcarpal, carpometacarpal, metacarpophalangeal, and interphalangeal joints.
The deformation also involves deformity of the bone bases that compose the joints.
Post-inflammatory lesions in the tendon sheaths and tendons occur in the hand during RA.

osteoarthritis ( oa ) is the most common form of arthritis and the leading cause of disability , especially among older adults . 
 the disease process leads to limitation of joint movement , joint deformity , tenderness , inflammation , and severe pain . 
 oa is characterized by progressive loss of cartilage from the articulating surfaces of diarthrodial joints . although the pathophysiologic mechanisms of osteoarthritis remain unresolved , chondrocytes in oa cartilage demonstrated morphologic changes that are characteristic features of apoptosis , which suggests apoptosis plays an important role in the development of oa [ 36 ] . 
 conventional approaches for the treatment of oa range from conservative measures , to surgical intervention , and eventually joint replacement [ 79 ] . 
 curren
facts_entailed: Osteoarthritis (OA) is the most common form of arthritis and the leading cause of disability, especially among older adults.
OA is characterized by progressive loss of cartilage from the articulating surfaces of diarthrodial joints.

Although the pathophysiologic mechanisms of osteoarthritis remain unresolved, chondrocytes in OA cartilage demonstrated morphologic changes that are characteristic features of apoptosis, suggesting apoptosis plays an important role in the development of OA [36].
Conventional approaches for the treatment of OA range from conservative measures, to surgical intervention, and eventually joint replacement [79].

facts_entailed: The short half-life of natural somatostatin and rebound hypersecretion of growth hormone make it impractical for therapeutic use.
A long-acting somatostatin analogue, SMS 201-995, (Sandoz, Basel, Switzerland) recently became available for clinical use.

the potential relevance of endothelial activation biomarkers to sepsis has been raised in both this journal and others [ 1 - 3 ] . 
 biomarkers for sepsis associated with the endothelial glycocalyx remain relatively unknown , however , and this commentary attempts to reverse this omission . 
 the term glycocalyx ( sweet husk ) was introduced 50 years ago to describe an extracellular polysaccharide coating of cells . 
 whilst electron microscopy revealed that the luminal surface of the endothelium expressed this structure , it was thought to be of little consequence or functional significance . 
 what has become increasingly evident , however , is that the glycocalyx - now estimated to extend up to 1 m from the endothelial cell membrane - represents a substantial intravascular compartment c
facts_entailed: The potential relevance of endothelial activation biomarkers to sepsis has been raised in both this journal and others [1-3].
Biomarkers for sepsis associated with the endothelial glycocalyx remain relatively unknown.
Electron microscopy revealed that the luminal surface of the endothelium expressed the glycocalyx structure.
It was initially thought that the glycocalyx was of little consequence or functional significance.
What has become increasingly evident is that the glycocalyx, now estimated to extend up to 1 m from the endothelial cell membrane, represents a substantial intravascular compartment.

 natural products are an excellent source of chemical structures with a wide variety of biological activities .

facts_entailed: Natural products are an excellent source of chemical structures with a wide variety of biological activities.
The development and progression of diabetic complications can be prevented by controlling blood glucose.
It is difficult to maintain normal blood glucose levels in a diabetic patient.

Ethics approval for the study was provided by the ethics review board of the Hospital for Sick Children.
PCS installations were made at intersections with controlled traffic signals.

facts_entailed: Each of the participating sites received institutional review board approval (e-table 1).

Patients with PAH (who group 1 pulmonary hypertension; Venice 2003 definition), confirmed by right-sided heart catheterization, were enrolled consecutively from March 2006 through December 2009 after providing informed consent.
Only patients with pulmonary capillary wedge pressure ≤ 15 mm Hg were included.

idiopathic intracranial hypertension ( iih ) , previously termed pseudotumor cerebri and benign intracranial hypertension , is a syndrome of increased intracranial pressure ( icp ) of unknown etiology , without clinical , laboratory or radiological evidence of intracranial pathology . 
 while the exact pathogenesis remains unclear , the chronic increased icp in this condition may lead to morphological intracranial changes . though traditionally performed to exclude lesions that produce intracranial hypertension , imaging in recent years 
 has been shown to detect changes involving the orbit , sella and sinovenous system , providing important clues to the diagnosis . 
 we describe the case of a lady with chronic headache , where magnetic resonance imaging ( mri ) showed features suggestive
facts_entailed: Idiopathic intracranial hypertension, previously termed pseudotumor cerebri and benign intracranial hypertension, is a syndrome of increased intracranial pressure (ICP) of unknown etiology, without clinical, laboratory, or radiological evidence of intracranial pathology.
The exact pathogenesis of idiopathic intracranial hypertension remains unclear.
Chronic increased ICP in idiopathic intracranial hypertension may lead to morphological intracranial changes.

Traditionally performed to exclude lesions that produce intracranial hypertension, imaging in recent years has been shown to detect changes involving the orbit, sella, and sinovenous system, providing important clues to the diagnosis.
We describe the case of a lady with chronic headache, where magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed features suggestive.

source:
schizophrenia , affecting around 1% of the population , is a severe disorder involving chronic or recurrent psychosis and long - term deterioration in functional capacity ( 1 ) . 
 the characteristic onset of schizophrenia in early adulthood , its lifelong course , and debilitating symptoms , plus its high burden on caregivers and the society make it one of the most disabling and economically catastrophic disorders ( 1 ) . despite the improvement of antipsychotic medications , as the main - stay of treatment for patients with schizophrenia , 
 the symptom response is not always optimal , side - effects are frequent , and treatment adherence is often poor ( 2 - 4 ) . therefore , still a large number of studies are ongoing for identifying new drugs of different classes that may be effective
facts_entailed: There is schizophrenia, affecting around 1% of the population, which is a severe disorder involving chronic or recurrent psychosis and long-term deterioration in functional capacity (1).

The characteristic onset of schizophrenia is in early adulthood, its course is lifelong, and it has debilitating symptoms, making it one of the most disabling and economically catastrophic disorders (1).
A large number of studies are ongoing to identify new drugs of different classes that may be effective for treating schizophrenia.

source: the findings reported here draw on answers to questions added to the two major cohort studies of hiv - positive people in ontario , the ontario hiv treatment network cohort study ( ocs ) ( http://www.ohtncohortstudy.ca/ ) ( n  =  959 ) and the positive spaces , healthy places cohort study ( pshp ) ( http://www.pshp.ca/ ) ( n  =  442 ) plus in - depth qualitative interviews with 122 ocs participants . drawing from all three data sources allows for broad representation of people living with hiv in accord with the epidemiology of hiv prevalence in ontario as measured by risk group , age , gender , sexual orientation , and ethno - cultural origin . of the 122 interviews , 8 were conducted in french in ottawa , the rest being in english in toronto ( n  =  93 ) and ottawa ( n  =  21 ) where 83%
facts_entailed: Findings reported here draw on answers to questions added to two major cohort studies of HIV-positive people in Ontario.
The two major cohort studies are the Ontario HIV Treatment Network Cohort Study (OCNS) with 959 participants and the Positive Spaces, Healthy Places Cohort Study (PSP) with 442 participants.
Plus, in-depth qualitative interviews with 122 OCS participants were conducted.

Broad representation of people living with HIV was aimed for, aligning with the epidemiology of HIV prevalence in Ontario based on risk group, age, gender, sexual orientation, and ethnic-cultural origin.
Eight of the 122 interviews were conducted in French in Ottawa, and the rest were in English in Toronto (93 in Toronto and 21 in Ottawa).
83% of the interviews were conducted in English.

the control of pain , a complex and subjective experience , is critical to clinical success in caring for patients . 
 opioids such as oxycodone , methadone and morphine are the recommended therapy by the world health organization and the european association for palliative care for moderate to severe pain . 
 however , the use of opioids in pain management requires careful dose escalation and empirical adjustments based on clinical response and the presence of side effects or adverse drug reactions ( adrs ) . 
 unfortunately , successful pain management treatment - defined as adequate analgesia without excessive adverse effects   - can be challenging . 
 unpleasant opioid side effects , such as nausea , vomiting , constipation and sedation , are common and can lead to absence from work ,
facts_entailed: The use of opioids in pain management requires careful dose escalation and empirical adjustments based on clinical response and side effects or adverse drug reactions (ADRs).
Successful pain management treatment, defined as adequate analgesia without excessive adverse effects, can be challenging.

facts_entailed: Many behavioral and neurophysiological studies have emphasized the importance of spatial co-localization and temporal synchrony for intersensory pairing.

facts_entailed: Nucleosomes, the basic structural units of chromatin, are now thought to be involved in this process.

The dissociation or displacement of nucleosomes from DNA by the action of other protein factors, such as DNA- and histone-modifying enzymes, likely gives the basal transcription apparatus access to the promoter regions of genes.
Nucleosomes are present in eukaryotic cells.

the term mucosa - associated lymphoid tissue ( malt ) lymphoma was first coined by isaacson and wright1 in 1983 . 
 malt lymphomas can occur in many locations , including the gastrointestinal tract , salivary glands , thyroid , lung , and breast . 
 it is histologically characterized by lymphoepithelial lesions and lymphoplasmic epithelial invasion.1,2 lymphomas that occur in the colon account for 10% to 20% of lymphomas of the gastrointestinal tract , 2.5% of all lymphomas , and 0.2% to 0.6% of colorectal malignant tumors , and thus , are rare.2,3 most of the colonic malt lymphomas present as a nonpedunculated protruding polypoid mass and/or ulceration . 
 cases of primary colonic malt lymphoma reported in korea have presented as multiple submucosal tumors ( one case),4 a nonpedunculated
facts_entailed: The term mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma was first coined by Isaacson and Wright in 1983.
Histologically, MALT lymphomas are characterized by lymphoepithelial lesions and lymphoplasmacytic epithelial invasion.
Lymphomas occurring in the colon account for 10% to 20% of gastrointestinal tract lymphomas, 2.5% of all lymphomas, and 0.2% to 0.6% of colorectal malignant tumors, making them rare.
Cases of primary colonic MALT lymphoma reported in Korea have presented as multiple submucosal tumors (one case).

facts_entailed: Autogenous grafting is the most commonly used surgical procedure for bone reconstruction.
Its advantages include biocompatibility and bone regeneration potential.

Several possibilities are reported for atrophic jaws reconstruction, including intra- and extra-oral autogenous grafts, allografts, alloplastic, and xenogenic grafts, with or without membranes for guided bone regeneration.
Autogenous bone grafts are considered the most suitable for oral and maxillofacial region defects.
They provide live immunocompatible bone.
Autogenous bone grafts are the only type of graft that provides live immunocompatible bone.

 the problem of al contamination in our environment has been around for more than 25 years , despite which , it remains a neglected problem . 
 in particular , al is found in materials used in the pharmaceutical industry , and in manufactured foodstuffs , cosmetics and tap water . by overcoming the body barriers 
 , al can infiltrate into the blood and promote toxic effects in liver , bone and the central nervous system .

facts_entailed: In particular, Al is found in materials used in the pharmaceutical industry, and in manufactured foodstuffs, cosmetics, and tap water.

macula - on rhegmatogenous retinal detachment ( rd ) is a common cause of ophthalmic emergency that requires surgical treatment in a short period of time to prevent visual loss . 
 the annual incidence of rd varies according to the recent references between 15.4   and 18.2 per 100  000 , with a peak incidence of 52.5 per 100  000 people between 55 and 59 years of age .

 the risk of rd is 4 times higher in patients who have undergone cataract surgery [ 5 , 6 ] .

reactive   oxygen species ( ros ) , normally produced during the aerobic metabolism , function as second messengers involved in many cellular functions . on the other hand , when ros level increases because of oxidant treatments and/or defective antioxidant systems , these highly reactive compounds and radicals become dangerous toxic agents . 
 in fact , ros may cause severe damages to several cellular macromolecules , including proteins , lipids , and dna , thus contributing to the development of many pathological conditions . 
 indeed several evidences have been reported , indicating that the redox homeostasis is a finely regulated mechanism involved in normal cellular functions and prevention of several stress - associated pathologies .

facts_entailed: Evidence suggests that redox homeostasis is a finely regulated mechanism involved in normal cellular functions and prevention of several stress-associated pathologies.
Many drugs have toxic side effects because of their impact on redox homeostasis.

the bacterium escherichia coli is widely used as indicator of the bacteriological condition of food and environments due to its almost exclusively fecal origin . 
 the presence of e. coli in fresh - marketed seafood indicates recent contamination and is usually attributed to infected handlers or storage on contaminated ice . 
 the intensification of production and the consequent increase in stocking density have made fish farming more vulnerable to disease [ 3 , 4 ] . 
 the indiscriminate use of antibiotics to treat infections and promote growth has been shown to be inefficient in the long run and to put selective pressure on bacterial populations favoring the development of resistant strains potentially hazardous to public health [ 57 ] .

facts_entailed: Fish farming has become more vulnerable to disease due to the intensification of production and increased stocking density.

In 2009, half of Canadian patients initiating renal replacement were over 65 years old.
According to estimates, the incidence of chronic renal failure is 242 individuals per one million worldwide.
Over $1 trillion is spent annually for end-stage renal disease care globally.

esophageal achalasia is a rare motility disorder of the esophagus involving the smooth muscle layer and the lower esophagus sphincter ( les ) , with its incomplete relaxation and increased tone . 
 this pathology is characterized by difficulty in swallowing , regurgitation , and sometimes chest pain . 
 specific tests for diagnosis of esophageal achalasia are barium swallow and esophageal manometry . esophago - gastro - duodenoscopy with or without endoscopic ultrasound can be also performed to rule out the probability of cancer . for management , dilation or stretching of the esophagus , surgery and injection of muscle relaxing substances ( botulin toxin ) in the esophagus were foreseen .

facts_entailed: esophageal achalasia is a rare motility disorder of the esophagus involving the smooth muscle layer and the lower esophagus sphincter (les).
the incomplete relaxation and increased tone of the lower esophagus sphincter (les) are characteristic features of esophageal achalasia.
patients with esophageal achalasia experience difficulty in swallowing, regurgitation, and sometimes chest pain.
specific tests for diagnosing esophageal achalasia include barium swallow and esophageal manometry.
endoscopic procedures such as esophago-gastro-duodenoscopy with or without endoscopic ultrasound may be used to rule out the presence of cancer.
management options for esophageal achalasia include dilation or stretching of the esophagus, surgery, and injection of muscle-relaxing substances (botulin toxin) into the esophagus.
a case presentation involves a patient experiencing intense rest and effort dyspnea and persistent symptoms.

the constant shortage of donor organs led to research into xenotransplantation , which was first reported in 1906 . 
 pigs are currently considered the most appropriate source of organs for xenotransplantation to humans based on several advantages , including physiological / anatomical organ similarities , reproductive characteristics , the possibility of controlled breeding , and ethical considerations . 
 furthermore , recently , research to avoid the rejection of grafted organs has involved the production of genetically - modified pigs such as the  1,3-galactosyltransferase gene knock - out pig , expression of human complement regulatory proteins ( cd46 , cd55 , and/or cd59 ) , and reducing risk of endogenous porcine retrovirus infection . to resolve existing hurdles prior to the clinic
facts_entailed: Pigs are currently considered the most appropriate source of organs for xenotransplantation to humans based on several advantages.

Research to avoid organ rejection in xenotransplantation also includes the expression of human complement regulatory proteins (cd46, cd55, and/or cd59) and reducing risk of endogenous porcine retrovirus infection.

The initial focus of harmonization has been on standardizing analytical processes and methods.
The scope of harmonization extends beyond standardizing analytical processes and methods.

facts_entailed: Coronary heart diseases are responsible for almost half of all deaths in developed countries and 25% of deaths in developing countries.
Open heart surgery with median sternotomy is most commonly performed on patients with blocked heart vessels.
It can impede normal respiration, deep breathing, effective coughing, and sputum clearance, and may result in respiratory dysfunction, hypoxemia, atelectasis, and pneumonia.
Effective pain management leads to earlier recovery, reduces the postoperative complications and duration of hospitalization, and increases patient satisfaction.
One of the simplest and cheapest nonpharmacologic ways to relieve pain is the use of cold.
Cold therapy is an effective and safe method with few complications or no side effects.

primary hyperparathyroidism ( phpt ) is a disease characterized by hypercalcemia due to autonomous production of parathyroid hormone ( pth ) . 
 phpt is the third most common endocrine disorder in the west after diabetes mellitus and thyroid disorders . 
 overall , about 1% of the adults have phpt in the west , and this figure rises to 2% in people older than 55 years . with the advent of multichannel biochemical screening in the 1970s , 
 the clinical profiles of phpt remarkably differ with regions of the world . in developing countries , such as india , 
 phpt is still uncommonly diagnosed , overtly symptomatic disease with skeletal , muscular , and renal manifestations . 
 in contrast , phpt has become an asymptomatic disease in the west with classic manifestations seen only in 2% cases
facts_entailed: Primary hyperparathyroidism (PHPT) is a disease characterized by hypercalcemia due to autonomous production of parathyroid hormone (PTH).
PHPT is the third most common endocrine disorder in the west after diabetes mellitus and thyroid disorders.
Overall, about 1% of adults have PHPT in the west, and this figure rises to 2% in people older than 55 years.
With the advent of multichannel biochemical screening in the 1970s, the clinical profiles of PHPT remarkably differ with regions of the world.
In developing countries, such as India, PHPT is still uncommonly diagnosed, overtly symptomatic disease with skeletal, muscular, and renal manifestations.
In contrast, PHPT has become an asymptomatic disease in the west with classic manifestations seen only in 2% cases.

whereas the incidence has increased from 1 in 10,000 - 50,000 spontaneous pregnancies , with assisted reproductive technology procedures , the incidence is up to 1% , a 70-fold increased risk .

facts_entailed: The incidence of heterotopic cervical pregnancy increases from 1 in 10,000 to 1 in 50,000 spontaneous pregnancies.
The incidence with assisted reproductive technology procedures is up to 1%.
There is a 70-fold increased risk with assisted reproductive technology procedures.
Several approaches are used for heterotopic cervical pregnancy management.
The purpose of conservative management is fertility preservation.
Surgical treatments include uterine artery ligation and embolization, Foley catheter insertion, and cervical curettage with or without cerclage.
Medical treatments include transvaginal potassium chloride (KCl) or methotrexate (MTX) injection.
In 1994, Frates et al. reported the first live birth of a heterotopic cervical pregnancy.
The first live birth was managed with transvaginal ultrasound-guided selective reduction with KCl.

facts_entailed: Obesity is a major cause of morbidity in Canada and in many parts of the world and it is increasing worldwide.
A body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to 30 kg/m² is used to indicate obesity.
Obesity is a risk factor for cardiovascular disease, type 2 diabetes, several types of cancer, asthma, gallbladder disease, osteoarthritis, and chronic back pain according to references [1, 2].
Class II+ obesity (BMI ≥ 35 kg/m²) is also associated with an increased risk of all-cause mortality.
The 2006 direct medical cost of overweight and obesity in Canada was $6.0 billion.
Obesity has reached a historic high in Canada with one-third of the population being obese according to a global background comprising of 500 million obese adults.

antibiotic resistance has become one of the most important public health problems worldwide due to morbidity and mortality and healthcare costs . 
 although the spanish national health system ( snhs ) has a population coverage of almost 100% , 30% of all antibiotic use occurs outside the snhs and is largely due to the dispensing of antibiotics without a medical prescription ( dawmp ) . 
 although this practice is unlawful , it is common in spain , favoured by the fact that it is not a punishable offence . 
 this , in turn , means that dispensing depends on the attitude of the individual pharmacist . 
 this study sought : ( i ) to estimate the percentage of pharmacists who employ dawmp ; and ( ii ) to identify such pharmacists ' personal and professional traits , as well as their knowledge
facts_entailed: The Spanish National Health System (SNHS) has a population coverage of almost 100%.

An 18-year-old Caucasian man presented with a painful rash on the trunk that had developed over the course of a few weeks.

primary spontaneous pneumothorax ( psp ) is a benign disease , usually occurring in young patients without known underlying lung disorder .

 depending on the individual severity , the therapeutic options include simple observation , needle aspiration , tube thoracostomy and definite operation . if surgery is indicated , video - assisted thoracoscopic surgery ( vats ) using an endoscopic linear cutter to resect the involved blebs is currently the most popular treatment .

 thanks to the increased experience with therapeutic thoraco
facts_entailed: The occurrence rate of primary spontaneous pneumothorax is reported to be about 9 individuals per 100,000 each year.
If surgery is indicated, video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS) using an endoscopic linear cutter to resect the involved blebs is currently the most popular treatment.
The hospital avoids using the endoscopic staple device due to its exclusion from the national health insurance system in Taiwan.
Increased experience with therapeutic thoracoscopy has contributed to these treatment approaches.

facts_entailed: Prostate cancer is the most common malignant disease of men in western countries.
Its incidence is continuously increasing in Korea.
The age-standardized incidence rates per 100,000 men for prostate cancer in 2007 was 4.6 cases, ranking the 8th highest cause among organ-specific malignant tumors.
Many pre-treatment prognostic factors have been proposed to determine treatment modalities.
The Gleason system has been proved to be one of the most important prognostic factors.
Histological variation within each tumor results in two grades: the predominant, or primary grade, and the less extensive, or secondary grade.
Biopsy-derived Gleason score (BGS) is used as one of the most important pretreatment prognostic factors.

Platelet concentrates showed enormous benefits for patients by favoring and accelerating post-surgical recovery and providing support for tissue regeneration through growth factors contained in them.

dyslipidemia is a disorder of lipid and lipoprotein metabolism , including overproductivity , deficiencies , or other changes in lipid metabolism , which results in abnormal amounts of lipids and lipoproteins in the blood . 
 dyslipidemia can manifest as an elevation of the total cholesterol ( tc ) , low - density lipoprotein ( ldl)cholesterol , or triglyceride ( tg ) concentration , or a reduction in the high - density lipoprotein ( hdl)cholesterol concentration in the blood ( goldberg , 2013 ) . 
 abnormal lipid levels are one of the essential causes of atherosclerosis and coronary artery disease ( cad ) ( vance and vance , 2008 , world health organization , h.g.p . , 1999 ) . 
 when lipoproteins in the plasma , and hence in the arterial wall , fall below a certain threshold level , athe
facts_entailed: Dyslipidemia is a disorder of lipid and lipoprotein metabolism involving overproduction, deficiencies, or other changes in lipid metabolism.
Abnormal lipid levels can manifest as elevated total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein cholesterol, or triglyceride concentration, or reduced high-density lipoprotein cholesterol concentration.
Atherosclerosis and coronary artery disease are conditions caused by abnormal lipid levels.
Lipoproteins in plasma and arterial walls can fall below a certain threshold level, leading to atherogenesis.

 the lateral borders of the retrorectal space are formed by the ureters , the iliac vessels , the sacral nerve roots , and the lateral stalks of the rectum .

facts_entailed: Tailgut cysts are also known as retrotrectal cystic hamartomas.
Tailgut cysts are rare congenital developmental lesions arising from postnatal primitive gut remnants.
Tailgut cysts generally occur in the retrorectal space.
Tailgut cysts can also be found in prerectal and perirenal locations.
The retrorectal space is a potential space bound anteriorly by the mesorectum and posteriorly by the sacrum.

The inferior border of the retrorectal space is formed by the rectosacral fascia.
The lateral borders of the retrorectal space are formed by the ureters, the iliac vessels, the sacral nerve roots, and the lateral stalks of the rectum.
The retrorectal space contains loose connective tissue, the middle sacral, iliolumbar, and middle hemorrhoidal vessels, and branches.

 it is a pure , unique chemical entity consisting of five saccharide units ( pentasaccharide ) obtained entirely by chemical synthesis .

facts_entailed: It is indicated for preventing thrombus formation in patients with acute coronary syndromes, including those with ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI), non-STEMI, or unstable angina.
It is a pure, unique chemical entity consisting of five saccharide units (pentasaccharide) obtained entirely by chemical synthesis.
However, inhibition of factor xa results in effective and linear dose-dependent inhibition of thrombin generation, whether triggered by intrinsic or extrinsic pathways.
Unlike conventional antithrombotics such as LMWHs (enoxaparin), which act on multiple targets within a coagulation pathway.

fixed drug eruption ( fde ) is a distinctive variant of drug induced dermatoses characterized by sharply demarcated , erythematous patches with / without blistering that develop within hours of administration of the causative drug and heals with postinflammatory residual hyperpigmentation . 
 it usually recurs at the same site of the skin or mucous membrane upon subsequent exposure to the same / similar group of drugs . 
 fluoroquinolones are widely used antimicrobials , which cause cutaneous adverse drug reactions in about 1 - 2% of patients . however , bullous fde is rarely reported .

facts_entailed: It usually recurs at the same site of the skin or mucous membrane upon subsequent exposure to the same/similar group of drugs.
Fluoroquinolones are widely used antimicrobials causing cutaneous adverse drug reactions in about 1-2% of patients.
Bullous FDE is rarely reported.

facts_entailed: Fierce competition for better mating partners has been a driving force for the evolution of diverse forms and behaviors in sex-related traits.
During fertilization, sperms from multiple males have been involved in natural experimentation in every single fertilization.
This natural experimentation has selected sperms that work best in their fertilization environment, leading to diversification of sperm morphology.
Extensive diversification of sperm morphology and physiology has been observed across other species, serving as a resource for resolving species phylogenies.
The evolution of sperm tail in insects and other arthropods is particularly rapid and diverse.

hepatitis e virus ( hev ) is a nonenveloped , single stranded rna virus which belongs to the hepeviridae family . 
 hev is a causative agent for acute hepatitis in one - third of the world 's population and fulminant hepatitis in pregnant women . 
 the virion is relatively resistant to environmental conditions and remains infectious even in rough situation such as sewage . 
 therefore the major route of hev transmission is the ingestion of the fecal contaminated water ; however , hev can be spread zoonotically and by blood transfusion especially in industrialized countries . 
 although there is an inclusive debate on the parental route of transmission , available evidence seems to prove the ability of the virus to cause congenital infections . 
 hev infection is a significant public health
facts_entailed: The virion of HEV is relatively resistant to environmental conditions and remains infectious in rough situations like sewage.
The major route of HEV transmission is the ingestion of fecally contaminated water, though it can also be spread zoonotically and by blood transfusion in industrialized countries.
There is an ongoing debate about the parental route of transmission, but evidence suggests the virus can cause congenital infections.
HEV infection is a significant public health issue.

facts_entailed: The patient is a 57-year-old woman.
A double chamber pacemaker was initially implanted for complete atrioventricular block.
The patient was upgraded to CRT-T after a year due to left ventricular dysfunction and dyspnea.
The patient was referred to the referring center 3 months after the upgrade due to a wound infection caused by Pseudomonas sp. (retained suture).
Preoperative transthoracic (TEE) and transesophageal (TOE) echocardiography did not reveal any signs of endocarditis.
The patient was afebrile with negative blood cultures.
A patent foramen ovale (PFO) with a small left-to-right shunt was identified.
Traction with locking stylets allowed the complete extraction of the active fixation right atrial and right ventricular leads.
The coronary sinus lead was explanted by simple traction.
No signs of endocarditis were detected preoperatively.
The patient was afebrile and had negative blood cultures preoperatively.

facts_entailed: Cerebrovascular diseases can result in irreversible brain damage manifested by functional impairments in consciousness, movement, senses, recognition, comprehension, and language.

These factors contribute to problems with postural control.
Postural control evaluation and training are important for the rehabilitation of balance and walking ability.

facts_entailed: Nine human hereditary neurodegenerative disorders are mentioned, including Huntington's disease (HD) and several spinocerebellar ataxias (SCAs).
HD is triggered by the expression of at least 36 CAG repeats located in exon 1 of the HTT gene.
Sca1 is caused by at least 39 CAG repeats present in exon 8 of the ATXN1 gene.
Sca3 (also known as Machado-Joseph disease) is induced by at least 60 CAG repeats occurring in exon 10 of the ATXN3 gene.

transorbital intracranial injury is rare and may cause serious brain damage and is associated with a high mortality rate . 
 this type of injury , accounting for 4.5% of all orbital pathology,[35 ] represents 0.04% of all head trauma , 24% of penetrating head trauma in adults , and 45% in children . 
 penetrating orbital injury may lead to severe brain injury when the foreign object enters the cranium , leading to both orbital and cerebral complications . 
 a foreign body can penetrate the brain through the orbit in 3 ways : via the orbital roof , the superior orbital fissure , and the optic canal . 
 the diagnosis is confirmed if an entire or partial foreign object is found in the wound , and is difficult to make in the case of trivial trauma . 
 we report a case of a transorbital injury

This type of injury represents 45% of penetrating head trauma in children.
Penetrating orbital injury may lead to severe brain injury when the foreign object enters the cranium, leading to both orbital and cerebral complications.

The diagnosis is confirmed if an entire or partial foreign object is found in the wound, and is difficult to make in the case of trivial trauma.
We report a case of a transorbital injury.

facts_entailed: A 2-year-old Asian Indian female presented with mild fever and swelling of the right upper lid lasting 10 days.
There was no history of preceding viral illness or significant medical history requiring antibiotic treatment.
Cutaneous anthrax was unlikely due to the absence of unexplained cattle deaths in the environment.
On examination, the child had a low-grade fever and no other skin lesions.
Ophthalmological examination revealed right upper lid edema with a large black necrotic area adherent to underlying tissues.
The child was examined by a pediatrician to rule out other foci of infection.
Microscopic examination of the skin biopsy revealed Staphylococcus, thus ruling out cutaneous anthrax.

facts_entailed: Stroke is a neurological disease caused by the cutoff of normal blood supply due to vessel rupture or thrombosis, and it causes brain tissue damage.
Motor, sense, recognition, language, and perception deficits are typical symptoms of the disease, depending on the affected areas, size, and the cause of damage.
Stroke patients mainly experience motor disorders and degeneration of balancing ability due to unbalanced posture.
This is caused by asymmetric arrangement and hemiplegia, and this disrupts independent activities of daily living (ADL).
The ability to balance is an individual's ability to maintain the center of gravity within a base region, keeping the body in a balanced state.

facts_entailed: The discovery of vitamin K antagonists (VKAs) in anticoagulation occurred in the 1920s.
Veterinarian Frank Schofield studied the hemorrhagic disease affecting cattle consuming sweet clover in the 1920s.
In 1939, Karl Link's team extracted dicumarol and identified the hemorrhagic agent in spoiled sweet clover.
Dicumarol was the substance in the sweet clover affecting coagulation.
The discovery of dicumarol made it possible to inhibit thrombosis and to study anticoagulation therapy for humans in the early 1940s.
In the 1930s and 1940s, Professor Armand Quick developed a routine prothrombin time (PT) coagulation test.
This PT coagulation test served as a basis for oral anticoagulant therapy (OAT) monitoring from the onset.

facts_entailed: It is characterized by high spiking fever, typical skin rash, and polyarthritis.
Main biological features include neutrophilic leukocytosis, hyperferritinemia, and negative rheumatoid factor (RF) or antinuclear antibodies (ANA).
Life-threatening prognosis depends on serious complications such as hepatic failure, disseminated intravascular coagulopathy, hemophagocytosis, infections, amyloidosis, and cardiomyopathy.
In the article, a successful combined therapy of prednisolone (PD), colchicine (COL), and cyclophosphamide (CYC) is suggested.

While typical cases exist, the characteristics of granulosa cell tumours in clinical practice do not always conform to these scenarios.

facts_entailed: The formation of long-lasting memories depends upon enduring changes in the strength of neurotransmission that alter cellular mechanisms and reconfigure neural circuitry and communication.

This review describes the relationship among extracellular matrix (ECM) molecules, cell adhesion molecules (CAMs), matrix metalloproteinases (MMPS), and tissue inhibitors of matrix metalloproteinases (TIMPs) in making possible the phenomena of long-term potentiation (LTP), habituation, associative learning and memory, and perhaps drug addiction.
The ECM is composed of secreted glycoproteins and proteoglycans that form scaffolding to which cells adhere.
Within the central nervous system, this network consists of the proteins fibronectin, laminin, vitronectin.

chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( copd ) , as a common problem in the elderly , is a major cause of chronic morbidity and mortality throughout the world.1 it is characterized by chronic obstruction of expiratory flow affecting peripheral airways , and is often associated with chronic bronchitis and emphysema , thereby accelerating the decline in lung function.2,3 previous studies have found that nutritional status is the prognostic factor that is associated with the mortality in copd.46 weight loss is the major characteristic of malnutrition in copd.7 in 2002 ,  nutritional risk  was defined by the european society for parenteral and enteral nutrition ( espen).8 recently , nutritional risk was found to be associated with the exacerbation of copd in the patients who were hospitalized
facts_entailed: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a common problem in the elderly.
COPD is a major cause of chronic morbidity and mortality worldwide.
COPD is characterized by chronic obstruction of expiratory flow affecting peripheral airways.
COPD is often associated with chronic bronchitis and emphysema.
Nutritional status is a prognostic factor associated with mortality in COPD.
Weight loss is a major characteristic of malnutrition in COPD.
In 2002, nutritional risk was defined by the European Society for Parenteral and Enteral Nutrition (ESPEN).
Nutritional risk has been found to be associated with the exacerbation of COPD in hospitalized patients.

fundamental concepts in psychology and philosophy of the mind are the notion of sensation and perception . when a stimulus produces an effect on different sensory receptors it induces sensation . 
 subsequent interpretation and organization of this sensory stimulus produce a meaningful experience of the world and of one 's perception . 
 although in most cases perception is conscious , perception without awareness does exist , that is , the interpretation of semantic stimuli . normally wakefulness and awareness are related ; one has to be awake ; that is , there has to be a certain level of consciousness to be aware of something ; that is , there is content in consciousness . in states of deep sleep , anesthesia , and coma 
 there is little or no wakefulness and hence no awareness . in dro
facts_entailed: Fundamental concepts in psychology and philosophy of the mind include the notion of sensation and perception.
When a stimulus produces an effect on different sensory receptors, it induces sensation.
Subsequent interpretation and organization of sensory stimuli produce a meaningful experience of the world and of one's perception.
Perception can be conscious or without awareness, with perception without awareness existing for the interpretation of semantic stimuli.
Normally, wakefulness and awareness are related; one must be awake to be aware of something.
In states of deep sleep, anesthesia, and coma, there is little or no wakefulness and hence no awareness.

facts_entailed: C1-2 transarticular screw fixation was introduced by Margerl and is the main technique for wire fusion of C1 and C2 vertebrae.

lymphoepithelioma is a term used to designate an undifferentiated malignant epithelial tumor of the nasopharynx that is histologically distinctive because of a markedly prominent lymphoid infiltrate ( 1 ) . 
 carcinomas with similar histological features arising outside the nasopharynx are called lymphoepithelioma - like carcinoma ( lelca ) . 
 lelca occurs in organs such as salivary glands , the uterine cervix , the thymus , the lung , the skin , the stomach , the bladder , the prostate , and the breast ( 2 ) . 
 it is very rare that lelca occurs in the urinary system , there is one case where it occurred in the renal pelvis , and one case where it occurred in the ureter and the kidney simultaneously , but has not been reported so far in urinary bladder in korea . the author et al . 
 hav
facts_entailed: Lymphoepithelioma is a term used to designate an undifferentiated malignant epithelial tumor of the nasopharynx with a prominent lymphoid infiltrate.
Carcinomas with similar histological features outside the nasopharynx are called lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma (LELC).
LELC can occur in organs such as salivary glands, the uterine cervix, the thymus, the lung, the skin, the stomach, the bladder, the prostate, and the breast (2).

It is very rare for LELC to occur in the urinary system, with only one case reported in the renal pelvis and another in the ureter and kidney simultaneously, though no cases have been reported in the urinary bladder in Korea.
The author et al. provided this information.

 cyclooxygenase enzymes catalyze the conversion of arachidonic acid to pgh2 , which is converted to other prostanoid species including pgd2 , pge2 , pgf2 , prostacyclin ( pgi2 ) , and thromboxane ( tx ) a2 by the action of specific synthases [ 13 ] . 
 the synthesis of pgd2 from its precursor pgh2 is catalyzed by two pgd synthases ( pgdss ) . 
 prostaglandin d2 ( pgd2 ) is involved in a wide variety of neurophysiological functions , such as regulation of body temperature , hormone release , modulation of odor and pain responses , and regulation of the sleep - wake cycle in mammals .

facts_entailed: Cyclooxygenase enzymes catalize the conversion of arachidonic acid to PGIH2, which is further converted into other prostanoid species including PGD2, PGE2, PGF2, prostacyclin (PGI2), and thromboxane (TX)A2 by specific synthases [13].
PGD2 acts through two receptors (DP1 and DP2).

facts_entailed: The disease is a major social and economic scourge in tropics and subtropics of Africa, Asia, Western Pacific and parts of America.
The disease affects over 120 million people in 80 countries.
Filarial disease is endemic all over India, especially in Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, Andhra Pradesh, Orissa, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Gujarat.
There are at least six million annual attacks of acute filarial disease.
Approximately 45 million persons are currently affected by one or more chronic filarial lesions.
Conventional mode of diagnosis for filariasis involves the demonstration of microfilaria in peripheral blood smear.
Despite high incidence, microfilariae are infrequent to be found in fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) smears and body fluids.
The literature contains a few reports of microfilariae found in various locations.

percutaneous nephrolithotomy ( pnl ) is the gold standard for treating patients with kidney stones over 2 cm in diameter . 
 it has replaced open surgeries due to equal efficacy , less morbidity , and higher patient acceptance . however , the most common complications are still urine extravasation , infection , and bleeding . 
 the classic procedure consists of four major steps : insertion of a ureteral catheter , execution of percutaneous access to the kidney with tract dilation , lithotripsy and stone extraction , and finally protection of the tract with a nephrostomy tube . 
 tract dilation may be conducted with the aid of metallic alken dilators , plastic amplatz dilators , or a pneumatic dilator . 
 one - stage tract dilation is also a well - known technique ; however , it is not util
facts_entailed: One-stage tract dilation is a known technique, though it is not commonly used.

facts_entailed: Eleven percent of women will have undergone an operation for prolapse or urinary incontinence by the age of 80.
OAB is a highly prevalent disorder that increases with age in both sexes and profoundly impacts quality of life according to the International Continence Society (ICS).
OAB is defined as urgency with or without urge incontinence, usually accompanied by frequency and nocturia.

antitumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) biologics appeared over a decade ago in the armamentarium for inflammatory bowel disease ( ibd ) . 
 originally evaluated in crohn 's disease ( cd ) and thereafter in ulcerative colitis ( uc ) , their efficacy was demonstrated in both diseases and has deeply modified the management of patients with ibd . 
 although they are potentially able to change the natural course of ibd and to decrease the need for surgery , absence or loss of response is frequent and only one - third of patients remain in clinical remission at 1 year . clinical response , steroid - free remission , and mucosal healing have been correlated with drug trough levels [ 3 , 4 ] . however , anti - tnf pharmacokinetic is characterized by a considerable interindividual variability and antidr
facts_entailed: The antitumor necrosis factor (TNF) biologics appeared over a decade ago in the treatment of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
Initially evaluated in Crohn's disease (CD) and subsequently in ulcerative colitis (UC), their efficacy was shown in both diseases.
The efficacy of TNF biologics has significantly impacted the management of patients with IBD.
Absence or loss of response to TNF biologics is common, with only one-third of patients achieving clinical remission at 1 year.
Clinical response, steroid-free remission, and mucosal healing have been associated with drug trough levels.
The pharmacokinetics of anti-TNF drugs exhibit considerable interindividual variability.

a major task for evolutionary biology has been to develop and test theories for the origin of novelty that are consistent with the fundamental genetic principles of gradual populational change . 
 novelty , however , is a loaded term with many different definitions that include or exclude a variety of morphological characters ( brigandt and love 2012 ) . 
 following pigliucci ( 2008 ) , we prefer a more inclusive definition of evolutionary novelty : new traits , or novel combinations of traits within a lineage that perform a new ecological function and may result in the establishment of new evolutionary lineages . 
 more narrowly focused definitions might be desirable for some purposes ( muller and wagner 1991 ; wagner and lynch 2010 ) . however , our goal in this essay is to elaborate one
facts_entailed: Novelty is a loaded term with many different definitions that include or exclude a variety of morphological characters according to Brigandt and Love (2012).

We prefer a more inclusive definition of evolutionary novelty: new traits, or novel combinations of traits within a lineage that perform a new ecological function and may result in the establishment of new evolutionary lineages.
More narrowly focused definitions might be desirable for some purposes, as noted by Pigliucci (2008), Müller and Wagner (1991), and Wagner and Lynch (2010).
